column4: i tried to configure xsever-xorg; but now i get a unsupported video mode when gnome starts; how to acces the commandline before entering gnome; i am now using the 6.06 live cd8

I configured the xsever-xorg file; but now i get a unsupported video mode when gnome starts; how to acces the commandline before entering gnome; i am now using the 6.06 live cd; so i can undo  what i did
it stops loading graphically; but still tries to start gnome
i cant  acces the commandline to do that
how can i access the commanline before gnome starts

I configured the xsever-xorg file; but now i get a unsupported video mode when gnome starts; how to acces the commandline before entering gnome; i am now using the 6.06 live cd; so i can undo  what i did
mount /dev/hda1 /mnt/linux; chroot /mnt/linux and you can use your broken system
Substitute /dev/hda1 with the device your system resides on.
Of course, if /mnt/linux doesn't exist you first have to mkdir /mnt/linux
when i do sudo mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf.original /etc/X11/xorg.conf it gives this error ; unable to lookup ubuntu via gethostbyname()
it works! just wanted to say that
